data.title: WORLD SCREEN
data.text:
Top Stories

Fremantle Acquires Richard Williams Documentary

Fremantle has picked up the global distribution rights for the feature documentary On the Line: The Richard Williams Story, detailing the life and career of Venus and Serena Williams’ father and coach.

Top Stories

Telemundo Unveils 2023-24 Lineup

NBCUniversal Telemundo Enterprises has unveiled its highlights across entertainment, news and sports for the 2023-24 season, including new Tplus productions on Peacock.

Top Stories

Stephen Merchant’s The Outlaws Renewed

Prime Video and BBC One have picked up a third season of the comedy thriller The Outlaws from creator, star, writer and director Stephen Merchant (The Office).

Top Stories

New Metaverse Expansion for The Voice

ITV Studios has teamed with The Virtual Brand Group (VBG) for The Voice Studios, a new metaverse experience for the hit talent competition.

Top Stories

James Townley & Lucas Green Upped at Banijay

Banijay has elevated James Townley and Lucas Green to new roles at the helm of its non-scripted operation, Creative Networks.

Top Stories

A+E Networks EMEA Expands FAST Footprint

A+E Networks EMEA has rolled out three curated FAST channels on Samsung TV Plus: Inside Crime, Mystery TV and World War TV.

Top Stories

Envision Entertainment Sets Turbulence Anthology Adaptation

Envision Entertainment is adapting David Szalay’s novel Turbulence into an anthology series, with Leonardo Fasoli and Maddelana Ravagli (Gomorrah, ZeroZeroZero) tapped as showrunners.

Top Stories

LatAm Sales for Golden Boy

Eccho Rights has sealed several Latin American deals on its hit Turkish drama Golden Boy.

Top Stories

The Pharmacist Optioned by Compact Pictures

John McKay’s Glasgow-based indie Compact Pictures is developing an adaptation of Rachelle Atalla’s The Pharmacist.
